location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.361 of 1852 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter with an enclosure, letter no.355 of 1852 from Kemball to Major Atkins Hamerton, Her Majesty's Consul and the Honourable Company's Agent in the dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muscat, dated 18 October 1852. In his letter to Hamerton, Kemball writes of the apparent widespread sale and transport of plundered indigo from Muscat and its neighbouring towns, with has reached as far as Bahrain. Kemball also discusses the status of Fujeerah [Fujairah], whose possession is contested by the Imam of Muscat and Shaikh Sultan bin Saqr of Ra's al-Khaymah, and through which indigo has passed.
